Sentencas: Due to the elevated operating temperatures (800-1000 degrees C) of tubular solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC), severe thermal stresses are produced during their operation.
Titulo: Performance and thermal stress of tubular functionally graded solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Functionally graded materials (FGMs) are used in anodes and cathodes to reduce the specific thermal stresses.
Titulo: Performance and thermal stress of tubular functionally graded solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The use of FGMs compensates for the effect of any sudden shift in the coefficient of thermal expansion of these electrodes with respect to the electrolyte.
Titulo: Performance and thermal stress of tubular functionally graded solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this study, the tubular SOFC efficiency, performance, and produced thermal stresses were numerically investigated.
Titulo: Performance and thermal stress of tubular functionally graded solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A 3D numerical model that includes the equations of mass conservation, momentum, charging transport, and electricity was developed.
Titulo: Performance and thermal stress of tubular functionally graded solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: These coupled equations of the electrochemical phenomena were solved using ANSYS 19.1-Fluent Solver.
Titulo: Performance and thermal stress of tubular functionally graded solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The temperature values that were obtained were sequentially introduced into the structural finite element model as body loads, and the model was solved with ANSYS 19.1-MAPDL Solver.
Titulo: Performance and thermal stress of tubular functionally graded solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The numerical model was validated against previously published experimental results.
Titulo: Performance and thermal stress of tubular functionally graded solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: For both electrodes, the FGM was identified by a grading index m.
Titulo: Performance and thermal stress of tubular functionally graded solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The use of the FGM for the anode and cathode instead of conventional electrodes increased the tubular SOFC efficiency and reduced the thermal stress.
Titulo: Performance and thermal stress of tubular functionally graded solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Optimum results were obtained at grading index m = 2.0, with the cell output increased by 8 % and induced thermal stresses well below the yielding levels.
Titulo: Performance and thermal stress of tubular functionally graded solid oxide fuel cells
Performance and thermal stress of tubular functionally graded solid oxide fuel cells
